# SRDeletionRecord

**Class**

An object that describes the reason the framework deletes samples.

## Declaration

```swift
class SRDeletionRecord
```

## Overview

When there are gaps in a recorded sensor’s data, deletion records account for the occasions when the framework deliberately removes the records. A deletion record specifies the time range when records are unavailable (see [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRDeletionRecord/startTime] and [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRDeletionRecord/endTime]), and the [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRDeletionRecord/reason] for removal.

To access deletion records for a particular sensor, create a new reader by applying the `sr_sensorForDeletionRecordsFromSensor()` extension of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] to the source sensor.

```swift
let deletionRecordsReader = SRSensorReader(sensor: ambientLightSensor.rawValue.sr_sensorForDeletionRecordsFromSensor())
deletionRecordsReader.delegate = myAmbientLightDeletionRecordsDelegate
```

## Accessing the Deletion Reason

- **reason**: The reason the framework deletes samples.
- **SRDeletionReason**: Reasons that the framework deletes samples.

## Accessing the Deletion Time

- **startTime**: The time the framework begins deleting samples.
- **endTime**: The time the framework finishes deleting samples.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
